statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ -12 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^3

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ -12 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^3.
